Job__05.1: Call now if there be any that will answer thee, and turn to some of the saints.
Job__05.2: Anger indeed killeth the foolish, and envy slayeth the little one.
Job__05.3: I have seen a fool with a strong root, and I cursed his beauty immediately.
Job__05.4: His children shall be far from safety, and shall be destroyed in the gate, and there shall be none to deliver them.
Job__05.5: Whose harvest the hungry shall eat, and the armed man shall take him by violence, and the thirsty shall drink up his riches.
Job__05.6: Nothing upon earth is done without a voice cause, and sorrow doth not spring out of the ground.
Job__05.7: Man is born to labour and the bird to fly.
Job__05.8: Wherefore I will pray to the Lord, and address my speech to God:
Job__05.9: Who doth great things and unsearchable and wonderful things without number:
Job__05.10: Who giveth rain upon the face of the earth, and watereth all things with waters:
Job__05.11: Who setteth up the humble on high, and comforteth with health those that mourn.
Job__05.12: Who bringeth to nought the designs of the malignant, so that their hands cannot accomplish what they had begun:
Job__05.13: Who catcheth the wise in their craftiness, and disappointeth the counsel of the wicked:
Job__05.14: They shall meet with darkness in the day, and grope at noonday as in the night.
Job__05.15: But he shall save the needy from the sword of their mouth, and the poor from the hand of the violent.
Job__05.16: And to the needy there shall be hope, but iniquity shall draw in her mouth.
Job__05.17: Blessed is the man whom God correcteth: refuse not therefore the chastising of the lord:
Job__05.18: For he woundeth, and cureth: he striketh, and his hands shall heal.
Job__05.19: In six troubles he shall deliver thee, and in the seventh, evil shall not touch thee.
Job__05.20: In famine he shall deliver thee from death: and in battle, from the hand of the sword.
Job__05.21: Thou shalt he hidden from the scourge of the tongue: and thou shalt not fear calamity when it cometh.
Job__05.22: In destruction and famine then shalt laugh: and thou shalt not be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
Job__05.23: But thou shalt have a covenant with the stones of the lands, and the beasts of the earth shall be at peace with thee.
Job__05.24: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle is in peace, and visiting thy beauty thou shalt not sin.
Job__05.25: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be multiplied, and thy offspring like the grass of the earth.
Job__05.26: Thou shalt enter into the grave in abundance, as a heap of wheat is brought in its season.
Job__05.27: Behold, this is even so, as we have searched out: which thou having heard, consider it thoroughly in thy mind.
